school: Studying in Japan (Saga Women’s Junior College)
story: After completing high school in 2019, I faced challenges in continuing my education due to the political situation in Myanmar. During that period, I supported my family by helping manage our shop, where I developed strong responsibility, adaptability, and communication skills.In 2023, I made the decision to pursue my dream of studying in Japan. Through intensive study, I successfully passed the JLPT N2 and the IT Passport Examination. These experiences strengthened both my technical knowledge and my determination to grow internationally.Currently, I am studying IT and communication in Japan, focusing on web development and modern technologies such as React and the MERN stack. I am especially interested in how technology can improve communication and create meaningful user experiences.I am a positive, growth-oriented individual who values teamwork and continuous self-improvement. My goal is to build a career that connects technology and communication, contributing to society by developing solutions that are both practical and user-friendly.
